title: Beavis_and_Butthead_Do_America(DVDRip)(1996){badluck13_7}
description:
Directors:Mike Judge
Yvette Kaplan

Writers:Mike Judge (written by) &
             Joe Stillman (written by)

Release Date:20 December 1996 (USA)  

Genre:Animation | Adventure | Comedy

Tagline:Coming to a screen bigger than your TV. 

Plot:Our intrepid adolescent heroes wake up to find their beloved television 
stolen, and embark on an epic journey across America to recover it... 

Awards-1 win & 3 nominations 

Rated PG-13 for continuous crude sex-related humor and language, and for a drug-related scene. 

Runtime:81 min 
Country:USA 
Language:English 
Color:Color 
Aspect Ratio:1.85 : 1 more 
Sound Mix:Dolby Digital 

Certification:Ireland:15 | South Korea:15 | Argentina:13 | Australia:M | Germany:16 | Netherlands:12 | Portugal:M/16 (video premiere) | Singapore:NC-16 | Sweden:7 | UK:12 | USA:PG-13 (certificate #34439) | Canada:G (Quebec) | Iceland:12 

Company:Paramount Pictures

Trivia:In the desert scene, where Beavis and Butthead hallucinate, voices are heard in the background. When the soundtrack is played backwards, Beavis and Butthead are heard speaking clearly, including phrases such as "Everybody go to college, study hard, study hard."

Goofs:Factual errors: The airplane is pictured with a red light on the tip of its starboard wing. This light should be green.

Quotes:[after apprehending Butt-head] 
Agent Fleming: Agent Hurley, I want you to give this scumbag a cavity search! I&#039;m talking Roto-Rooter! Don&#039;t stop until you reach the back of his teeth!

Fans of the television show will probably die laughing, but some others may enjoy it also. The film focuses on Beavis and Butt-Head as they go on a cross country road trip to recover their stolen television, but unknowingly fall deep into a plot involving the theft of a man-made biological weapon. The cast of voices are a real treat, especially Robert Stack as an ATF agent. Tune in if you&#039;re in the mood for a few laughs.
